Freezing

The Freezing status effect is a temporary condition that affects characters in the dungeon. When frozen, a character becomes immobilized and unable to take actions until the effect wears off or is removed.

Mechanics

  • Duration: The freezing effect typically lasts for 5f base duration, modified by resistance (as defined in Frost.java:5 and Frost.java:48-50)
  • Immobilization: While frozen, the affected character cannot move or take any actions (achieved via Frost.java:30)
  • Stacking: Usually does not stack with similar immobilizing effects like paralysis or stunning
  • Damage Interaction: Taking damage will break the freezing effect (as implemented in Frost.java:40-42)
  • Visual State: Frozen characters display a frozen state sprite (as defined in Frost.java:46)

Sources of Freezing

  • Frost-based attacks
  • Wand of Frost
  • Potion of Frost
  • Icecap plant
  • Water Elemental attacks
  • Cold Spirit attacks
  • Some enemy abilities

Countering Freezing

  • Waiting for the effect to naturally expire
  • Taking damage (breaks the effect)
  • Using items that clear status effects
  • Applying fire-based damage does not break freezing (fire immunity is separate)

Code Implementation

  • Freezing Application: Freezing.java - Applies frost to cells
  • Frost Status: Frost.java - Implements the actual freezing effect on characters
  • Duration Calculation: Frost.java:48-50 - Calculates duration based on resistance
  • String Resources: Frost strings - Name, description, and shatter message

Related Effects

  • Ice Elemental - Enemies that can apply freezing
  • Ice Guardian - Enemies that use freezing attacks
  • Paralysis - Similar immobilizing effect
  • Stun - Another temporary immobilization effect
